humanMachineDialogue.author: Memory Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The report states that the largest tumor size in the left breast is 6 cm, which is larger than the threshold for T3 tumors (more than 5 cm). Therefore, the pathologic T stage of the patient's cancer is T3.

humanMachineDialogue.author: ZS Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The T stage of breast cancer is determined by the size of the tumor. In this report, the tumor size is described as 'a 6.0 x 5.0 x 2.8 cm gray-white, ill-defined mass'. This means that the tumor is larger than 2 cm but not larger than 5 cm, which corresponds to T2 stage.
